title: Frank Lampard urged to re-sign Nathan Ake by Chelsea scout
text:
Ake spent five years at Chelsea (Picture: Getty)

Frank Lampard has been told by one of his scouts that Chelsea should re-sign Nathan Ake.

The Dutchman came through Chelsea’s youth ranks, but was sold to Bournemouth in 2017 after failing to nail down a place in the senior team.

Chelsea have been linked with signing Ake since his exit and club scout Piet de Visser believes it was a mistake to let Ake leave, telling De Volkskrant: ‘Ake should have played for Chelsea by now. He’s so good.

‘How often does he not score with his head? He has timing and insight. I hope they buy him back.

Lampard has built his Chelsea side on youth this season (Picture: Getty)

‘That boy is perfect for them and he has played with Lampard.’

Ake spent five years at Chelsea, but has flourished under the guidance of Eddie Howe at Bournemouth.

The 24-year-old made his 100th appearance for Bournemouth last weekend. With a transfer ban in place at Chelsea, Lampard has relied on his academy stars to step up.

Youngsters Mason Mount, Tammy Abraham and Fikayo Tomori have been Chelsea’s three best performers, although the change in ethos came too late for Ake.

Before Ake left, no academy star had managed to become a starter at Chelsea since John Terry.
